intro: Phanera ornata var. balansae, commonly known as the Balansae Phanera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, preferring moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected botanical gardens.
